column1: Joint Damage causing Pain and Loss of Function
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Whew. I have patellar tracking issues, mild osteoarthritis because of same, and both lateral and medial ligament sprains along with possible meniscal tear or frays. Basically, my knee is a mess and causes referred pain from ankle to hip, I await corrective surgery and am in PT. I can't take "pain killers" because I have two small children and a husband that travels, so drowsy/stoned is not an option. I begged for an anti-inflammatory-something OTHER than Ibuprofen which I was eating like candy. My mistake. It all went well for a quite a  days. I was careful to take with food, drink plenty of water, blah blah blah. I was a little more fatigued than usual, but the swelling under my knee subsided and the pain, overall, seemed somewhat eased and I was more mobile. Also, not waking in the night or waking TO pain was a plus. I was rx'd 500mg bid 2x but only took once, mid-day, after I felt I'd eaten something substantial. But the knee got me, and I started taking 2x a day. Then I got sick. I mean SICK  & as another poster said, ENDURING. I thought I'd gotten food poisoning. But, I didn't ever connect this to the relafen. I couldn't eat with all the vomiting, went on a BRAT diet, laid off ALL meds (sorry, knee) and FIVE days later started to feel normal again, went back on the Relafen, and that's when the bleeding started. Hemorrhaghic uterine non-menstrual bleeding. I'm otherwise healthy, have had ultrasounds, labs drawn, etc., and there is no other obvious reason. So now I'm having to take meds to stop that issue AND an anti-nausea because the new meds cause vomiting, and it took three days for the bleeding to stop. Needless to say,  I'm off the Relafen. I wish Vioxx wasn't killing seniors because those were the days, weren't they?

column9: Just started 1 day ago. 3 pills in my system so far & no issues. I have Degenerative Disc Disease in my Cervical Spine, as well as a new issue (yet to be diagnosed) in my Sacrum/Coccyx. I pray it continues to help me with no damaging side effects. Im very fortunate with various medications, they do what they are suppose to do, with litte side effect from anything. I've just been changed to the combination of Oxycontin-pain, Norflex-muscle relax, Percocet for break-thru pain during the day a needed, and now the Relafen for the inflamation. column9: I use this for Chronic Hip Bursitis.  I've tried several other anti-inflammatory drugs, and this keeps me pain free, and feeling "normal".  There have been a few times, I've forgotten to take it.  I'm reminded that same day with pain and limping.  The only thing I don't like are the bruises that pop up for no reason. Right now, I have 5 on one arm, 2 on the other, and at least 8 between both legs.  They're no larger than a half dollar, but I look like an abused woman.  I need to let my Dr. know, but I'm afraid he'll take it away!
